(That would be Redzepi.) The city that Noma built is now a culinary mecca not only for gastronauts but also for young cooks from around the world who come here to work at forward-thinking restaurants before going off to open their own casual concepts around town. That means that some of the best tacos, ramen, cocktails, and croissants you’ll ever have can be found in a city so beautiful, so bikeable, so lifestyle-enviable (especially during those long summer nights on the canals), you might consider staying for a few years too—if only to score a last-minute cancellation table at the new Noma 2.0.  —Christine Muhlke The Hit ListFacebookPinterestPhoto by
